summary: UTF-8 is a way to store and send text electronically, used for most websites. It can represent over 1 million characters from different languages and symbols. This encoding uses 1 to 4 bytes for each character, with more common ones using fewer bytes. It's designed to be compatible with older ASCII text, ensuring that simple text files remain the same. UTF-8 is widely supported by various software, making it a popular choice for international text display.
title: UTF-8
